intro: Restio laniger, commonly known as the woolly restio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family and is characterized by its tall, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in coastal and sandy environments, often found in dune ecosystems. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it plays a role in stabilizing coastal soils and supporting local biodiversity.
